title: Create a Basic HTML Document
description: Create a function that returns a complete HTML document structure with DOCTYPE, html, head, and body tags. The document should have a title "My First Page" and a heading "Hello World" in the body.
solution:
function createHTMLDocument() { return ` My First Page

Hello World

`; }

testCases.description: Body should contain h1 with "Hello World"

hints: Start with <!DOCTYPE html> to declare HTML5
Use template literals for multiline strings
Include meta tags for charset and viewport

title: Create a Paragraph with Formatting
description: Write a function that creates an HTML paragraph with mixed text formatting. Include bold, italic, and underlined text.

testCases.description: Should create paragraph with strong and em tags

hints: Use <strong> for bold text
Use <em> for italic text
Template literals make string interpolation easier

title: Build an Unordered List
description: Create a function that takes an array of items and returns an HTML unordered list.

testCases.description: Should create ul with li elements

hints: Use map() to transform array items into <li> tags
Use join() to combine the array into a string
Wrap everything in <ul> tags

title: Create Hyperlinks
description: Write a function that creates an anchor tag with proper attributes including href, title, and target.

testCases.description: Should add target blank for new tab

hints: Use the href attribute for the URL
Add target="_blank" for new tab
Include rel="noopener noreferrer" for security

title: Create an Image Tag
description: Create a function that generates an img tag with src, alt, width, and height attributes.

testCases.description: Should create img with all attributes

hints: The alt attribute is important for accessibility
Width and height should be numbers (no units)
Self-closing tags don't need a closing slash in HTML5

title: Build a Simple Table
description: Create a function that generates an HTML table from a 2D array. The first row should be table headers.

testCases.description: Should create table with thead and tbody

hints: Use <thead> for headers and <tbody> for data rows
Headers use <th> tags, data uses <td> tags
The first array is the header row

title: Create a Text Input Form
description: Write a function that creates a form with a text input field and a submit button. Include proper labels and attributes.

testCases.expectedOutput:
<form>
  <label for="username">Username:</label>
  <input type="text" id="username" name="username" placeholder="Enter your username">
  <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>
testCases.description: Should create form with label and input

hints: Associate label with input using "for" and "id" attributes
The name attribute is used for form submission
Use type="submit" for the button

title: Create a Select Dropdown
description: Create a function that generates a select dropdown from an array of options. Include a label and option values.

testCases.expectedOutput:
<label for="country">Country:</label>
<select id="country" name="country">
    <option value="usa">USA</option>
    <option value="canada">Canada</option>
    <option value="mexico">Mexico</option>
</select>

hints: Use map() to create option tags from the array
Value attribute should be lowercase for consistency
Associate label with select using "for" attribute

title: Semantic Article Structure
description: Create a function that builds a semantic article with header, main content, and footer sections.
solution:
function createArticle(title, author, date, content) { return `

${title}

By ${author} on ${date}

${content}

Posted on ${date}

`; }

testCases.input: createArticle("My Blog Post", "John Doe", "2024-01-15", "This is the content.")
testCases.expectedOutput:
My Blog Post

By John Doe on 2024-01-15

This is the content.

Posted on 2024-01-15

hints: Use <article> to wrap the entire content
Use <header>, <main>, and <footer> for sections
Use <time> tag with datetime attribute for dates

title: Navigation Menu
description: Create a semantic navigation menu using nav, ul, and li elements with proper ARIA attributes.

testCases.description: Should create semantic nav with links

hints: Wrap the list in a <nav> element
Use aria-label for accessibility
Each link should be inside an <li> element

title: Registration Form with Validation
description: Create a registration form with email, password, and checkbox inputs. Include HTML5 validation attributes.
solution:
function createRegistrationForm() { return `
`; }
hints: Use type="email" for email validation
Add "required" attribute for mandatory fields
Use minlength for password validation

title: Data List with Descriptions
description: Create a function that generates a description list (dl, dt, dd) from an object of term-definition pairs.

testCases.input: createDescriptionList({HTML: "HyperText Markup Language", CSS: "Cascading Style Sheets"})
testCases.description: Should create dl with dt and dd pairs

hints: Use Object.entries() to iterate over the object
<dt> is for the term, <dd> is for the definition
Wrap everything in <dl> tags

title: Responsive Image with srcset
description: Create a function that generates a responsive image with srcset and sizes attributes for different screen sizes.

testCases.description: Should create img with srcset and sizes

hints: srcset lists multiple image sources with their widths
sizes tells the browser how wide the image will be displayed
Use map() and join() to build the attribute strings

title: Accessible Form with Fieldsets
description: Create a contact form using fieldset and legend for grouping related fields. Include proper ARIA labels.
solution:
function createContactForm() { return `

Contact Us

Personal Information
Message
`; }

testCases.description: Should use legend for group labels

hints: Use <fieldset> to group related form fields
<legend> provides a caption for the fieldset
aria-labelledby connects the form to its heading

title: Complex Table with colspan and rowspan
description: Create a function that generates a table with merged cells using colspan and rowspan attributes.
solution:
function createComplexTable() { return `
Student Grades
Student Semester 1 Semester 2
Midterm Final Midterm Final
Alice 85 90 88 92
`; }

testCases.description: Should use colspan for horizontal merging
Should use rowspan for vertical merging

hints: colspan merges cells horizontally
rowspan merges cells vertically
Use <caption> to give the table a title

title: Complete Semantic Page Structure
description: Create a complete HTML5 page structure with semantic elements: header, nav, main, article, aside, and footer. Include proper landmark roles.
solution:
function createSemanticPage(title, navLinks, articleContent, asideContent) { const nav = navLinks.map(link => `
  • ${link.text}
    • `).join('\n'); return ` ${title}

    ${title}

      ${nav}

    Main Content

    ${articleContent}

    Related Information

    ${asideContent}

    © 2024 ${title}

    `; }

testCases.description: Should have main element with role

hints: Use semantic HTML5 elements: header, nav, main, article, aside, footer
Add ARIA landmark roles for better accessibility
The page should be a complete valid HTML5 document

title: Basic CSS Selector
description: Create a function that generates a CSS rule to set the color of all paragraphs to blue.
hints: Use the element selector "p" to target paragraphs
The color property sets text color
CSS syntax: selector { property: value; }

title: Class and ID Selectors
description: Create CSS rules using class selector (.classname) and ID selector (#idname).

testCases.description: Should use class selector with dot
Should use ID selector with hash

hints: Class selectors start with a dot (.)
ID selectors start with a hash (#)
Classes can be used multiple times, IDs should be unique

title: Box Model Properties
description: Create a CSS rule that sets margin, padding, border, width and height for a div.
hints: The box model consists of: content, padding, border, margin
All measurements need "px" units
Border shorthand: width style color

title: Text Styling Properties
description: Create CSS rules for text properties including font-family, font-size, text-align, and line-height.
hints: font-family can have fallback fonts separated by commas
font-size needs units (px)
line-height is typically unitless (relative to font-size)

title: Pseudo-class Selectors
description: Create CSS rules using pseudo-class selectors for hover, focus, and nth-child.
hints: Pseudo-classes start with a colon (:)
:hover applies when mouse is over element
:nth-child(odd) selects every odd child element

title: Flexbox Container
description: Create a flexbox container with justify-content, align-items, and flex-direction properties.
hints: display: flex enables flexbox layout
justify-content aligns items along main axis
align-items aligns items along cross axis

title: Flexbox Items
description: Create CSS rules for flex items including flex-grow, flex-shrink, and flex-basis.
hints: flex-grow determines how much item grows
flex-shrink determines how much item shrinks
flex-basis sets initial size before space distribution

title: CSS Grid Container
description: Create a CSS Grid container with grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows, and gap.
hints: display: grid enables grid layout
repeat() function creates repeating track patterns
fr unit represents a fraction of available space

title: Grid Item Placement
description: Create CSS rules for placing grid items using grid-column and grid-row properties.
hints: grid-column: start / end defines column span
grid-row: start / end defines row span
Grid lines start at 1, not 0

title: Responsive Grid Layout
description: Create a responsive grid that uses auto-fit and minmax for automatic column sizing.
hints: auto-fit automatically creates columns that fit
minmax(min, max) sets minimum and maximum column sizes
Columns will automatically wrap to new rows

title: Position Properties
description: Create CSS rules demonstrating different position values: static, relative, absolute, fixed, and sticky.
hints: static is the default position value
relative positions relative to normal position
absolute positions relative to nearest positioned ancestor
fixed positions relative to viewport

title: CSS Specificity Challenge
description: Create CSS rules with different specificity levels to demonstrate the cascade.
hints: Specificity hierarchy: inline > ID > class > element
More specific selectors override less specific ones
Combining selectors increases specificity

title: CSS Variables (Custom Properties)
description: Create CSS using custom properties (CSS variables) for colors and spacing with fallback values.
hints: Define variables in :root for global scope
Variable names start with --
Use var(--name, fallback) to reference variables
calc() can perform calculations with variables

title: Advanced Flexbox Layout
description: Create a complex flexbox layout with nested flex containers and various flex properties.
hints: flex shorthand: grow shrink basis
Nested flex containers are common in layouts
flex: 1 makes an item grow to fill space
flex: 0 0 auto prevents growing/shrinking

title: Complex Grid Areas
description: Create a grid layout using named grid areas for a complex page structure.

testCases.description: Should assign grid areas to elements

hints: grid-template-areas defines named regions
Each string represents a row
Repeating names make elements span multiple cells
Assign areas with grid-area property

title: Complete Responsive Card Component
description: Create a complete CSS for a responsive card component using modern CSS features including grid, flexbox, custom properties, and pseudo-elements.

testCases.description: Should use flexbox for card body

hints: Combine multiple CSS features for a complete component
Use CSS variables for maintainable values
Grid for overall structure, flexbox for internal layout
Add hover effects and transitions for interactivity
Include responsive adjustments with media queries

title: Basic Function Declaration
description: Create a function that takes two numbers and returns their sum.
hints: Use the return keyword to return a value
The + operator adds numbers together
Function parameters are like variables

title: Arrow Function Syntax
description: Convert a regular function to an arrow function that multiplies two numbers.
starterCode:
// Create an arrow function to multiply
const multiply = // Your code here
solution: const multiply = (a, b) => a * b;
hints: Arrow functions use => syntax
Single expression arrow functions have implicit return
Syntax: (params) => expression

title: Array Map Method
description: Use the map method to double all numbers in an array.
hints: map() creates a new array by transforming each element
map() takes a callback function as argument
The callback receives each element as parameter

title: Array Filter Method
description: Use the filter method to get only even numbers from an array.
hints: filter() creates a new array with elements that pass a test
Use modulo operator (%) to check for even numbers
num % 2 === 0 checks if a number is even

title: Object Property Access
description: Create a function that takes a person object and returns their full name.
hints: Access object properties with dot notation
Use template literals for string concatenation
Template literals use backticks and ${} syntax

title: Array Reduce Method
description: Use the reduce method to sum all numbers in an array.
hints: reduce() reduces an array to a single value
First parameter is accumulator, second is current value
The second argument to reduce() is the initial value

title: Object Destructuring
description: Use object destructuring to extract properties from an object.
hints: Destructuring syntax: const { prop1, prop2 } = object
Destructuring extracts properties into variables
Use shorthand syntax for returning objects

title: Spread Operator with Arrays
description: Use the spread operator to combine two arrays.
hints: Spread operator is ...
Spread unpacks array elements
Syntax: [...array1, ...array2]

title: Array Find Method
description: Use the find method to locate a user by ID in an array of user objects.
hints: find() returns the first element that matches
Returns undefined if no match found
Use comparison operator === to match id

title: Default Parameters
description: Create a function with default parameters for greeting a user.
hints: Default parameters: function(param = defaultValue)
Default value is used when argument is undefined
Use template literals for string formatting

title: Array Some and Every
description: Use some() and every() methods to check array conditions.
hints: every() returns true if all elements pass the test
some() returns true if at least one element passes
Both take a callback function as argument

title: Rest Parameters
description: Create a function that accepts any number of arguments using rest parameters.
hints: Rest parameters use ... syntax
Collects remaining arguments into an array
Use reduce() to sum, then divide by length

title: Object Methods and This
description: Create an object with methods that use the "this" keyword.

testCases.input: const c = createCounter(); c.increment(); c.increment(); c.getValue()

hints: Use "this" to refer to the current object
Method shorthand: methodName() {}
Arrow functions don't have their own "this"

title: Array Chaining Methods
description: Chain multiple array methods to transform data.
hints: Chain methods by calling one after another
filter() first to get adults
map() to extract names, sort() to alphabetize

title: Template Literals and Expressions
description: Create a function that generates HTML using template literals with embedded expressions.
hints: Template literals support multiline strings
Use ${} for expressions and variables
Ternary operator: condition ? trueValue : falseValue

title: Advanced Object Manipulation
description: Create a function that merges multiple objects, transforms values, and computes derived properties.

testCases.expectedOutput: {name: "Widget", price: 10, color: "blue", quantity: 5, totalPrice: 50, discount: 0, finalPrice: 50}
testCases.description: Should merge and calculate without discount

hints: Use spread operator to merge objects
Later properties override earlier ones
Calculate derived properties step by step
Return a new object with all properties

title: Select Element by ID
description: Create a function that selects an element by its ID and returns its text content.

testCases.description: Should get text content by ID
Should return null for missing element

hints: Use document.getElementById()
Check if element exists before accessing properties
textContent gets the text inside an element

title: Select Elements by Class
description: Create a function that counts how many elements have a specific class.
hints: Use document.getElementsByClassName()
Returns an HTMLCollection
Access length property to count

title: Query Selector
description: Use querySelector to find the first paragraph inside a div with class "container".

testCases.description: Should find first paragraph in container

hints: querySelector uses CSS selector syntax
Space between selectors means descendant
Returns only the first matching element

title: Query Selector All
description: Use querySelectorAll to get all list items and return their text content as an array.

testCases.description: Should get all li text content

hints: querySelectorAll returns a NodeList
Convert NodeList to array with Array.from()
Use map() to extract text from each element

title: Modify Element Text
description: Create a function that changes the text content of an element.
hints: Use getElementById to find the element
Set textContent property to change text
Check if element exists before modifying

title: Add and Remove Classes
description: Create functions to add and remove classes from an element.

testCases.description: Should add class when not present

hints: Use element.classList to work with classes
toggle() adds class if missing, removes if present
contains() checks if class exists

title: Modify Element Attributes
description: Create a function that sets multiple attributes on an element.
hints: Use setAttribute(name, value) to set attributes
Use Object.entries() to iterate over attributes object
forEach() to apply each attribute

title: Create and Append Elements
description: Create a function that creates a new paragraph element and appends it to a container.
hints: Use document.createElement() to create elements
Set textContent to add text
Use appendChild() to add element to parent

title: Simple Click Event Handler
description: Add a click event listener to a button that increments a counter.
hints: Use addEventListener("click", callback)
Update textContent in the event handler
Use closure to maintain count variable

title: Input Event Handler
description: Add an input event listener that displays the current value in real-time.

testCases.input:
document.body.innerHTML = '
'; mirrorInput("inp", "disp"); const inp = document.getElementById("inp"); inp.value = "test"; inp.dispatchEvent(new Event("input")); document.getElementById("disp").textContent

hints: Use "input" event for real-time updates
Event object has target.value for input value
Update display element in event handler

title: Remove Elements
description: Create a function that removes all elements with a specific class.

testCases.description: Should remove elements and return count

hints: Use querySelectorAll to find all elements
Call remove() method on each element
forEach works on NodeLists

title: Dynamic List Creation
description: Create a function that generates a list from an array of items.
hints: Create ul element first
Loop through items array
Create li for each item and append to ul

title: Event Delegation
description: Use event delegation to handle clicks on dynamically added list items.

testCases.input:
document.body.innerHTML = '
  • Item 1
'; let result; setupListClickHandler("list", (text) => result = text); document.querySelector("li").click(); result
testCases.description: Should handle li click via delegation

hints: Add listener to parent element (ul)
Check e.target.tagName to filter clicks
Event bubbles up from child to parent

title: Form Validation
description: Create a form validation function that checks if required fields are filled.

testCases.input: document.body.innerHTML = '<form id="f"><input name="email" required value=""></form>'; validateForm("f").isValid
testCases.description: Should fail validation for empty required field

testCases.input: document.body.innerHTML = '<form id="f"><input name="email" required value="test@test.com"></form>'; validateForm("f").isValid

hints: Use querySelectorAll("[required]") to find required fields
Check if value.trim() is empty
Build errors array with field names

title: Prevent Default Form Submission
description: Create a form submit handler that prevents default submission and processes data.

testCases.input: document.body.innerHTML = '<form id="f"><input name="username" value="john"></form>'; let result; handleFormSubmit("f", (data) => result = data); document.getElementById("f").dispatchEvent(new Event("submit")); result.username
testCases.description: Should pass form data to callback

hints: Use e.preventDefault() to stop form submission
FormData API extracts form values
Object.fromEntries converts FormData to object

title: Complete Todo List Manager
description: Create a complete todo list manager with add, remove, and toggle functionality.

testCases.input:
document.body.innerHTML = '
'; const mgr = createTodoList("todos"); mgr.addTodo("Test"); mgr.getTodos().length

document.body.innerHTML = '
'; const mgr = createTodoList("todos"); mgr.addTodo("Test"); mgr.toggleTodo(1); mgr.getTodos()[0].completed

hints: Maintain todos array as state
Each todo needs unique id, text, and completed status
render() recreates DOM from current state
Event handlers call methods that update state and re-render
Return object with public methods

title: Create Media Query Matcher
description: Write a function `matchesMedia(query)` that returns true if the given media query matches the current viewport. Use `window.matchMedia()` API.

testCases.expectedOutput: true or false based on viewport
true or false based on user preference

hints: Use window.matchMedia() to create a MediaQueryList object
Access the matches property to get the boolean result

title: Calculate Viewport Width
description: Create a function `getViewportWidth()` that returns the current viewport width in pixels.
hints: Use window.innerWidth for modern browsers
Fallback to document.documentElement.clientWidth for older browsers

title: Detect Current Breakpoint
description: Write a function `getCurrentBreakpoint()` that returns the current breakpoint name ("mobile", "tablet", or "desktop") based on viewport width. Mobile: <768px, Tablet: 768-1024px, Desktop: >1024px.
hints: Get the viewport width first
Use conditional statements to determine the breakpoint range

title: Calculate Fluid Font Size
description: Create a function `fluidFontSize(minSize, maxSize, minWidth, maxWidth)` that calculates a responsive font size using linear interpolation based on viewport width. Return a string like "clamp(minSize, calculation, maxSize)".

testCases.description: Fluid typography between mobile and desktop

hints: Calculate the slope: (maxSize - minSize) / (maxWidth - minWidth)
Calculate the y-intercept: minSize - slope * minWidth
Use template literals to format the clamp() CSS function

title: Calculate Aspect Ratio
description: Write a function `calculateAspectRatio(width, height)` that returns the aspect ratio as a string (e.g., "16:9"). Simplify to common ratios when possible.
hints: Use the greatest common divisor (GCD) to simplify the ratio
Implement GCD using Euclidean algorithm
Divide both width and height by the GCD

title: Check WCAG Color Contrast
description: Create a function `hasGoodContrast(color1, color2, level)` that checks if two hex colors meet WCAG contrast requirements. Level can be "AA" (4.5:1) or "AAA" (7:1). Return true/false.
hints: Convert hex colors to RGB first
Calculate relative luminance for each color
Contrast ratio = (lighter + 0.05) / (darker + 0.05)
AA requires 4.5:1, AAA requires 7:1

title: Select Responsive Image Source
description: Write a function `selectImageSource(sources, viewportWidth)` that takes an array of image sources with breakpoints and returns the appropriate source. Sources: [{url: "small.jpg", maxWidth: 768}, {url: "large.jpg", maxWidth: Infinity}].
hints: Sort sources by maxWidth in ascending order
Find the first source where viewport is less than or equal to maxWidth
Return the largest source as fallback

title: Convert Viewport Units to Pixels
description: Create a function `vwToPx(vw)` that converts viewport width units to pixels based on current viewport width.
hints: Get current viewport width using window.innerWidth
1vw = viewport width / 100
Multiply vw value by (viewport width / 100)

title: Add Media Query Listener
description: Write a function `onBreakpointChange(query, callback)` that listens for media query changes and calls the callback with the match status. Return a cleanup function.
hints: Create a MediaQueryList object using window.matchMedia()
Add an event listener for "change" events
Call the callback immediately with current match status
Return a cleanup function that removes the listener

title: Detect Keyboard Navigation
description: Create a function `isKeyboardNavigation()` that returns true if the user is currently navigating with keyboard (not mouse). Track the last interaction type.
hints: Listen for keydown events (specifically Tab key)
Listen for mousedown events
Maintain state tracking the current input method
Return a function that returns the current state

title: Calculate Responsive Grid Columns
description: Write a function `getGridColumns(viewportWidth)` that returns the appropriate number of grid columns based on viewport width. Mobile: 1, Tablet: 2, Desktop: 4.
hints: Use the same breakpoints as earlier exercises
Return different column counts for each breakpoint range

title: Detect Touch Support
description: Create a function `isTouchDevice()` that returns true if the device supports touch events.
hints: Check for "ontouchstart" in window object
Check navigator.maxTouchPoints property
Also check navigator.msMaxTouchPoints for IE compatibility

title: Validate Form Label Association
description: Write a function `hasValidLabel(inputElement)` that checks if a form input has a properly associated label (either wrapped or using for/id).
hints: Check if input is inside a label element using closest()
Check if input has an ID and there's a label with matching for attribute
Also check for ARIA attributes like aria-label
Return true if any method is found

title: Simulate Container Queries
description: Create a function `applyContainerClass(element, breakpoints)` that adds CSS classes based on element width (simulating container queries). Breakpoints: {small: 300, medium: 600, large: 900}.
hints: Get element width using offsetWidth property
Remove any existing container classes first
Compare width against breakpoints from largest to smallest
Add the appropriate class based on width

title: Check Reduced Motion Preference
description: Write a function `prefersReducedMotion()` that returns true if the user has enabled reduced motion in their OS settings.
hints: Use window.matchMedia() with the prefers-reduced-motion media feature
Check the matches property of the MediaQueryList object
The query string should be "(prefers-reduced-motion: reduce)"

title: Generate Type Scale
description: Create a function `generateTypeScale(baseSize, ratio, levels)` that generates a responsive typography scale. Return an array of font sizes calculated using the given ratio (e.g., 1.25 for major third).
hints: Use Math.pow() to calculate each level: baseSize * ratio^level
Create a loop for the number of levels
Round the results to 2 decimal places for cleaner values
Return an array of calculated sizes

title: Create a Simple Promise
description: Write a function `delay(ms)` that returns a Promise that resolves after the specified milliseconds.
hints: Return a new Promise
Use setTimeout to delay the resolve call
Call resolve() when the timeout completes

title: Random Success or Failure
description: Create a function `randomPromise()` that returns a Promise that randomly resolves with "Success!" or rejects with "Failed!" (50% chance each).
hints: Use Math.random() to generate a random number between 0 and 1
Call resolve() for success
Call reject() for failure

title: Convert Promise to Async/Await
description: Write an async function `waitAndReturn(value, ms)` that waits for the specified milliseconds then returns the value.
hints: Use await with a delay Promise
Return the value after the delay
The function must be declared as async

title: Fetch Multiple URLs Concurrently
description: Write an async function `fetchAll(urls)` that takes an array of URLs and returns a Promise that resolves with an array of all responses. Use Promise.all().
hints: Map over the URLs array to create fetch promises
Use Promise.all() to wait for all promises
Each fetch should be converted to JSON
Use await to get the final results

title: Safe Fetch with Error Handling
description: Create an async function `safeFetch(url)` that fetches data and returns {success: true, data} on success or {success: false, error} on failure.
hints: Use try/catch to handle errors
Check response.ok to verify HTTP success
Parse JSON in the try block
Return different objects for success and failure

title: Fetch with Timeout
description: Write a function `fetchWithTimeout(url, timeout)` that races a fetch request against a timeout. Reject if timeout is reached first.
hints: Create a timeout promise that rejects after the specified time
Use Promise.race() to race the fetch against the timeout
The first promise to settle wins

title: Process Items Sequentially
description: Write an async function `processSequentially(items, asyncFn)` that processes an array of items one by one (not in parallel) using the provided async function. Return array of results.
hints: Use a for...of loop to iterate sequentially
Await each async function call before proceeding
Collect results in an array
Do not use map() as it processes in parallel

title: Retry Failed Requests
description: Create an async function `retryFetch(url, maxRetries)` that retries a failed fetch request up to maxRetries times before giving up.
hints: Use a for loop from 0 to maxRetries
Try the fetch in each iteration
Catch errors and retry if attempts remain
Add exponential backoff between retries (optional but good practice)
Throw the last error if all retries fail

title: Create Debounced Fetch
description: Write a function `createDebouncedFetch(delay)` that returns a debounced fetch function. Multiple calls within the delay period should cancel previous pending requests.
hints: Use a closure to maintain timeout and abort controller state
Clear the previous timeout on each call
Use AbortController to cancel pending fetch requests
Return a new promise that resolves with the fetch result

title: Limit Concurrent Requests
description: Create an async function `fetchWithConcurrencyLimit(urls, limit)` that fetches URLs with a maximum of `limit` concurrent requests at a time.
hints: Keep track of currently executing promises
When limit is reached, wait for one to complete before starting another
Use Promise.race() to wait for the first completion
Remove completed promises from the executing array
Use Promise.all() to get all results at the end

title: Process API Response
description: Write an async function `fetchAndTransform(url)` that fetches data, filters items where status is "active", and maps to extract only id and name fields.
hints: Fetch and parse JSON first
Use filter() to keep only active items
Use map() to extract desired fields
Chain the array methods

title: Implement Fetch Cache
description: Create a function `createCachedFetch()` that returns a fetch function with caching. If the same URL is requested again, return cached data instead of fetching.
hints: Use a Map to store cached responses
Check if URL exists in cache before fetching
Store the parsed data in cache after first fetch
Return cached data on subsequent calls

title: Fallback Data Source
description: Write an async function `fetchWithFallback(primaryUrl, fallbackUrl)` that tries the primary URL first, and falls back to the fallback URL if primary fails.
hints: Try primary URL in a try block
Catch errors and try fallback URL
Check response.ok for both attempts
Throw error if both fail

title: Paginated Data Fetcher
description: Create an async function `fetchAllPages(baseUrl)` that fetches paginated data until there are no more pages. Each response has {data: [], nextPage: url|null}.
hints: Use a while loop to continue fetching while nextPage exists
Accumulate all data in an array
Update the URL to nextPage after each fetch
Stop when nextPage is null

title: Fetch Multiple with Status
description: Write an async function `fetchAllWithStatus(urls)` that fetches all URLs and returns results with status for each. Use Promise.allSettled() to get both successes and failures.
hints: Map URLs to fetch promises
Use Promise.allSettled() instead of Promise.all()
Check result.status for "fulfilled" or "rejected"
Format the output to include success status and data/error

title: Create Task Queue
description: Create a class `AsyncQueue` with methods `enqueue(asyncFn)` and `process()`. The process method should execute all queued async functions sequentially and return results.
hints: Store tasks in an array
Enqueue adds a task to the array
Process uses a while loop to execute tasks one by one
Use try/catch to handle task errors
Return an array of results with success status

title: Create CommonJS Module
description: Write a function that exports a simple calculator object with add and subtract methods using CommonJS module.exports.
hints: Create an object with add and subtract methods
Use module.exports to export the object
Each method should take two parameters and return the result

title: ES6 Named Exports
description: Create a utilities module with named exports for formatDate(date) and formatCurrency(amount). Use ES6 export syntax.
starterCode:
// Create utility functions
// Your code here
hints: Use export keyword before each function
formatDate should use toLocaleDateString()
formatCurrency should format to 2 decimal places with $ prefix

title: Create Component with Default Export
description: Write a function `createButton(text, onClick)` that returns a button configuration object and export it as default.
hints: Return an object with type, text, and onClick properties
Add a render method that returns HTML string
Use export default to export the function

title: Stateful Component Factory
description: Create a function `createCounter()` that returns a component with state and methods: getCount(), increment(), decrement().
hints: Use closure to maintain private state
Initialize count to 0
Each method should modify or return the count
Increment/decrement should return the new value

title: Validate Component Props
description: Write a function `validateProps(props, schema)` that validates props against a schema. Schema: {name: "string", age: "number"}. Return {valid: boolean, errors: []}.
hints: Iterate through schema entries
Check if each key exists in props
Check if the type matches using typeof
Collect all errors before returning

title: Create Test Assertion Helper
description: Write a function `assertEquals(actual, expected, message)` that throws an error if values don't match, otherwise logs success.
hints: Compare actual and expected using strict equality
Throw an Error with descriptive message if they don't match
Log success message if they do match
Include the custom message in both cases

title: Simple Test Runner
description: Create a function `describe(suiteName, tests)` that runs an object of test functions and reports results. Tests is an object where keys are test names and values are test functions.
hints: Iterate through test entries
Wrap each test execution in try/catch
Count passed and failed tests
Log results with visual indicators ( and )
Return summary object

title: Resolve Module Dependencies
description: Write a function `resolveDependencies(modules)` that takes a dependency graph and returns modules in correct load order. Input: {a: [], b: ["a"], c: ["a", "b"]}.
hints: Use topological sort algorithm
Track visited modules to avoid duplicates
Recursively visit dependencies first
Add module to result after all dependencies are resolved

title: Implement Component Lifecycle
description: Create a function `createComponent(config)` that supports lifecycle hooks: onMount, onUpdate, onUnmount. Return object with mount(), update(), and unmount() methods.

testCases.expectedOutput: Calls onMount when mount() is called
All hooks called at appropriate times

hints: Track mounted state with a boolean
Only call onMount when mounting for the first time
Only allow updates when mounted
Only call onUnmount when actually mounted
Check if hooks exist before calling them

title: Generate Build Configuration
description: Write a function `generateBuildConfig(env)` that returns different build configurations for "development" or "production" environments. Include sourceMap, minify, and outputPath.
hints: Create a base configuration object
Add environment-specific settings
Production should minify and exclude source maps
Development should include source maps and skip minification
Use object spread to combine base and env-specific config

title: Create Mock Function
description: Write a function `createMock(returnValue)` that returns a mock function which tracks calls and arguments. Mock should have .calls array and .calledWith(args) method.
hints: Use a closure to maintain calls array
Create a function that records arguments on each call
Add calls and calledWith as properties of the function
calledWith should check if any call matches the expected arguments

title: Simple State Management
description: Create a function `createStore(initialState)` that returns {getState, setState, subscribe}. Subscribers should be called when state changes.
hints: Store state in a closure variable
Maintain an array of subscriber functions
Notify all subscribers when state changes
subscribe should return an unsubscribe function
Use object spread to merge new state with old state

title: Create Plugin Architecture
description: Write a function `createApp()` that returns an app with plugin support. App should have use(plugin) method and run() method that executes all plugins in order.
hints: Store plugins in an array
Maintain a shared context object
use() should add plugin to array and return this for chaining
run() should execute each plugin with the context
Plugins are functions that receive the context

title: Detect Unused Exports
description: Write a function `findUnusedExports(moduleExports, imports)` that identifies exports that are never imported. Return array of unused export names.
hints: Flatten the imports array to get all imported names
Use a Set for efficient lookup
Filter exports to find those not in the used set

title: Calculate Test Coverage
description: Create a function `calculateCoverage(totalLines, coveredLines)` that returns coverage statistics: {percentage, covered, total, uncovered}.
hints: Calculate percentage: (covered / total) * 100
Calculate uncovered: total - covered
Round percentage to 2 decimal places
Return object with all statistics

title: Optimize Bundle Configuration
description: Write a function `optimizeBundle(files)` that takes an array of file objects {name, size, essential} and returns optimized bundle config. Remove non-essential files over 100KB, return {files, totalSize, savings}.

testCases.input: [{name: "a", size: 150, essential: false}, {name: "b", size: 50, essential: true}]

testCases.expectedOutput: All files kept regardless of size

hints: Calculate original total size first
Filter files: keep if essential OR size <= 100
Calculate new total size after filtering
Calculate savings as difference
Include savings percentage in result
